headline: RTX Corporation (RTX) Delivers Advanced Missile Defense Radar with GaN Technology
summary: On May 19, RTX Corporation (NYSE:RTX) announced that its Raytheon business delivered the first AN/TPY-2 radar to the U.S. Missile Defense Agency with a complete Gallium Nitride (GaN) populated array. The missile defense radar will defend the United States and its allies by tracking, detecting, and discriminating against ballistic missiles. The latest radar version featuring […]

headline: RTX Wins $581M Contract for Next Generation Jammer Mid-Band System
summary: RTX's unit, Raytheon, secures a $581 million contract from the U.S. Navy involving the Next Generation Jammer Mid-Band (NGJ-MB) System.

raw.headline: RTX Wins $581M Contract for Next Generation Jammer Mid-Band System
raw.summary: RTX's unit, Raytheon, secures a $581 million contract from the U.S. Navy involving the Next Generation Jammer Mid-Band (NGJ-MB) System.

headline: RTX's Raytheon delivers 13th AN/TPY-2 radar for the U.S. Missile Defense Agency
summary: Raytheon, an RTX (NYSE: RTX) business, has delivered the first AN/TPY-2 radar to the U.S. Missile Defense Agency with a complete Gallium Nitride, or GaN, populated array. The AN/TPY-2 is a missile defense radar that is ready to defend the U.S. homeland and American allies by detecting, tracking and discriminating ballistic missiles in multiple phases of flight.

raw.headline: RTX's Raytheon delivers 13th AN/TPY-2 radar for the U.S. Missile Defense Agency
raw.summary: Raytheon, an RTX (NYSE: RTX) business, has delivered the first AN/TPY-2 radar to the U.S. Missile Defense Agency with a complete Gallium Nitride, or GaN, populated array. The AN/TPY-2 is a missile defense radar that is ready to defend the U.S. homeland and American allies by detecting, tracking and discriminating ballistic missiles in multiple phases of flight.

headline: RTX's Raytheon delivers 250th RAM launcher to U.S. Navy
summary: Raytheon, an RTX (NYSE: RTX) business and German industrial partner RAM-Systems GmbH, delivered the 250th RAM MK49 Guided-Missile Launching System (GMLS) to the U.S. Navy. It will be deployed on the USS Pittsburgh, a new-construction San Antonio-class amphibious transport dock.
